intro: Corallocarpus leiocarpus, commonly known as the smooth-capsuled corallocarpus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of small white or yellowish flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that remains closed until maturity, releasing seeds when disturbed. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
